entry.title: SAP 分析云建模扩展与集成 2025 QRC3 版本新功能速览
entry.content:
目的   

尊敬的 SAP 社区同事：   

在 2025 年 QRC3 版本（BDC中的 SAC建模模块）中，我们为您带来了一系列重磅更新，功能焕然一新！

温馨提示：QRC3 版本将于八月中旬在您的客户端正式上线，以下内容为您抢先揭秘新功能亮点，敬请期待！ 

功能总览   

本次更新为您带来三大核心能力，详情如下：   

  1. 全新公式：WAVG（加权平均值）   
  2. FIRST、LAST 与 AVERAGE 支持含无值数据的异常聚合 
  3. 数据导出 API —— 增量聚合（Delta Aggregation） 

1.全新公式：WAVG（加权平均值）   

WAVG（加权平均）公式现已上线建模器。该公式可根据指定权重成员的对应值，计算某一成员的加权平均值，适用于标准模型和账户模型。 

加权平均计算方式： 

Dimension  

Price 

Stock 

Price * Stock 

Bread 

2 

10 

20 

Bread 

3 

20 

60 

Bread 

4 

30 

120 

Total 

8 

60 

200 

表 1：含产品、价格与库存数据的示例表   

表 1 列出若干产品及其单价与库存量。 

要计算平均价格，请使用以下公式计算： 

(2 + 3 + 4) / 3 = 3 

要计算加权平均价格，请使用以下公式计算： 

(2*10) + (3*20) + (4*30) / (10 + 20 + 30) = 200 / 60 = 3.33 

通过引入权重，加权平均计算能更精准地反映实际价值。 

语法：   

WAVG([度量值] 或 [账户成员], [指定权重], [维度1], [维度2], ..., [维度10]) 

示例：   

图 1：WAVG 语法示例   

上述 WAVG 公式以 [Volume] 作为权重，计算在给定 [Date] 和 [Product] 维度下的 [Price] 加权平均值。   

WAVG 公式最多可引用 10 个维度。   

注意：目前仅支持在层次结构的叶节点（最低层级）对该计算度量进行输入。后续版本计划扩展至其他层级的成员。 

2.FIRST、LAST 与 AVERAGE 支持含无值数据的异常聚合 

新增三种异常聚合方式，现可在单一维度下，对基础度量或基础账户进行 FIRST、LAST 以及 AVERAGE 计算，并包含无值数据： 

  • Average incl. Unbooked计算所选期间内所有聚合值（含无值数据）的平均值。   
  • First incl. Unbooked返回所选期间内最早（时间最靠前）的值，包含无值数据。   
  • Last incl. Unbooked  返回所选期间内最新（时间最靠后）的值，包含无值数据。 

图 2：建模器中新增的异常聚合选项 

这些异常聚合方式同时支持标准模型与账户模型，可在聚合数据时给出更精确的结果。 

【示例】“Average including unbooked” 异常聚合： 

图 3：示例说明“Average incl. Unbooked”如何将期间内的所有月份纳入计算，而非仅含有值数据的月份   

在上例中，对某一基础度量应用了“Average incl. Unbooked”异常聚合。各季度合计：Q1 为 100，Q2 为 200，Q3 为 300，Q4 为 400。   

仅考虑有值数据时，平均值是这些值的总和，除以有值条目的数量，即 

(100 + 200 + 300 + 400) ÷ 4 = 250   

考虑含无值数据时，期间共 12 个月全部纳入计算，得到更精确的平均异常聚合，即   

  (100 + 200 + 300 + 400) ÷ 12 ≈ 83.33 

【示例】“First incl. Unbooked” 异常聚合： 

图 4：示例展示“First incl. Unbooked”如何将期间所有月份纳入计算，而非仅含有值数据的月份   

图 4 通过对比说明：使用“First incl. Unbooked”异常聚合时，系统会考虑首月无值数据值；而传统“First”聚合仅返回有值数据的首个值。   

即使二月已有数据，顶层仍显示无值数据值，因为公式已将一月（无数据）纳入计算，从而为该期间内的“First”异常聚合提供更精确的结果。 

图 5：示例说明“Last incl. Unbooked”如何在给定期间内把无值数据纳入“最后值”计算   

图5展示了“Last incl. Unbooked”与“Last（仅含有值数据）”两种聚合方式的差异。在传统“Last”模式下，10 月已有有值数据 400，且它是最后一个含有值数据的期间，因此 400 被带到层级顶层并显示出来。而“Last incl. Unbooked”同样把 10 月的 400 纳入计算，但最后一个期间是 12 月，该月存在无值数据。由于该无值数据也被视为有效，12 月的数据被推送至顶层，从而得到更贴近真实情况的 Last 聚合结果。 

3.数据导出 API —— 增量聚合（Delta Aggregation） 

数据导出 API 现已扩展，新增 “FactDataAggregation” 端点，支持将已聚合的事实数据增量导出。   

这意味着，系统可先把发生变动的事实数据聚合，再仅导出这些聚合结果，而无需导出所有变动明细。该功能与 S/4 使用聚合事实数据的方式相辅相成。   

建模者也可在模型的 “API Subscriptions” 标签页内直接访问此功能。 

图 6：在模型的“创建订阅”区域中显示的“事实数据增量聚合”实体集   

增量聚合示例： 

Account 

Product 

Sales 

Account1 

Water 

100 

Account1 

Juice 

150 

Account2 

Water 

200 

Account2 

Juice 

150 

表2：Account1与Account2包含产品及销售额。 

表2显示，Account1和Account2共包含2种产品，每种产品在不同期间的销售金额各异。 

Account 

Sales 

Account1 

250 

Account2 

350 

表3：Account1 和 Account2的聚合值   

接下来，我们对两个账户的销售额进行调整： 

Account 

Product 

Sales 

Account1 

Water 

110 

Account1 

Juice 

80 

Account2 

Water 

75 

表4：销售额已发生变动，体现为事实数据更新 

Account1中“Water”的销售额由 100 调整为 110   

Account1中“Juice”的销售额由 150 调整为 80   

Account2中“Water”的销售额由 200 调整为 75   

Account2中“Juice”的销售额保持不变   

由此重新计算得到的聚合事实数据如下： 

Account 

Sales 

Account1 

((110 - 100) + (80 - 150)) = -60 

Account2 

((75-200) + (150 – 150)) = -125 

表5：聚合值的计算方式 

这些值即为通过“FactDataAggregation”端点，或在模型的 “API Subscriptions”中使用“Fact Data Delta Aggregation”实体集后，将要导出的聚合结果。 

结论   

总之，作为 2025 年 QRC3 版本的一部分，SAC（Business Data Cloud 模块）在“建模扩展”与“集成”领域推出了以下新功能与更新： 

    1.新增 WAVG 公式：可按对应权重成员的值，计算某成员的加权平均。   

    2.三种新的异常聚合方式   

  • First incl. Unbooked：在选定期间内，返回最早值（含无值数据）。   
  • Last incl. Unbooked：在选定期间内，返回最新值（含无值数据）。   
  • Average incl. Unbooked：在选定期间内，返回所有聚合值的平均（含无值数据）。 

    3.数据导出API 扩展：新增 “FactDataAggregation” 端点，支持将事实数据的“聚合增量”导出；建模者也可在模型的 API Subscriptions 标签页中，使用全新的 “Fact Data Delta Aggregation” 实体集。 

 

如有任何疑问，欢迎在下方留言，或前往SAC问答论坛发帖提问。

想进一步了解 FastTrack 与季度发布周期（QRC）的详情，请查阅相关 SAP 知识库文章。

更多产品资讯、最佳实践与社区资源，请访问SAC社区页面。

如需查看 2025 年 QRC 各租户的具体更新日期，可参考《SAP Analytics Cloud 季度发布周期（QRC）2025 租户更新时间表》。

想提前了解即将推出的新功能，欢迎浏览 SAP Road Map Explorer。

感谢阅读！

 

 

原文作者：Amanda

原文链接：https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/what-s-new-in-sap-analytics-cloud-modeling-extensions-amp-integration-qrc3/ba-p/14130035

entry.title: 2025 Q3 SAP Analytics Cloud compass Highlights
entry.content:
In the coming QRC3 release, compass users will be seeing two new features which will ease risk analysis further for end users: Relative range input and conflict driver detection.

Relative Range Input

Compass users will be able to enter their assumption for driver uncertainties as relative values, i.e. as offsets to the current baseline in the model. The offsets could be entered as percentage or numbers.  During input, a display below the input will show the converted absolute value for immediate visual validation.
Entering driver uncertainties as offsets will allow the capturing of assumptions which is more aligned with the business language, and also an easy application of the same effect (e.g. +5%) across different drivers. 
Another cool detail: Publishing a scenario will convert the relative inputs into absolute values for the public scenario, but once a private copy is create from this result, the input will be converted back into the relative ranges again. This is to respect the different needs between result consumption (public scenario) and scenario modelling (private scenario). 

Conflict Driver Detection

Scenario modelling is a very volatile process, and usually users are capturing their assumptions at the speed of their thoughts. During such a process it might at times lead to them creating conflicting drivers unintentionally, such as setting up driver uncertainties for overlapping drivers. An example could e.g. setting up uncertainties for revenue in Europe and Germany at the same time for the same scenario run (Germany is part of Europe, hence the overlap). In such cases, compass will indicate the conflict, assisting users to maintain a leaner and cleaner driver list with valid configurations. 

With these two new features we hope to boost the efficiency of scenario modelling for end users, making risk analysis even more approachable for business users. 
New to compass? Take a look at these blogs:

    • Introduction to Monte Carlo Simulation
    • General Release of SAP Analytics Cloud compass
    • A Step-By-Step Walkthrough for SAP Analytics Cloud compass (PART I)
    • A Step-By-Step Walkthrough for SAP Analytics Cloud compass (PART II)

entry.title: はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - データの切り替えボタンの作成
entry.content:
本ブログシリーズはSAP Analytics CloudのBI機能を使ってダッシュボードやレポートの作成を行う方を対象とし、SAP Analytics CloudのBIにおける基本の操作やTipsをハンズオン形式でご紹介します。

本ブログでは、ボタンひとつでメジャー・ディメンションを切り替えたい際にご使用いただけるデータの切り替えボタンの作成についてご紹介いたします。

 

 

目次：

  • SAP Analytics Cloudにおけるデータの切り替えボタンの概要
  • データの切り替えボタンの作成方法[ハンズオン]
    • メジャー入力コントロールの作成
    • ディメンション入力コントロールの作成

※ベースとなるサンプルストーリーの作成⼿順は、はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - サンプルモデル／ストーリーの作成 - SAP Communityでご紹介しています。
※ SAP Analytics Cloudは、四半期に１度のペースで製品のバージョンアップが実施されます。そのため今後のバージョンアップにより、本ブログで紹介する画⾯キャプチャや、操作が異なる可能性があることをご了承ください。（本ブログは2025年7⽉に作成しています。）

 

SAP Analytics Cloudにおけるデータの切り替えボタンの概要

データの切り替えボタンを使用すると、チャートで用いるメジャーやディメンションをボタンひとつで変更できる設定が可能です。「売上高のグラフをボタンひとつで営業利益のグラフに変えたい」ときや、「ディメンションを拠点別から製品別に変更したい」ときに便利です。

メジャー・ディメンションなどの用語の説明はこちら：はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - 用語入門 - SAP Community

メジャーを変更するコントロールを作成したい際はメジャー入力コントロール、ディメンションを変更するコントロールを作成したい際はディメンション入力コントロールを使用します。

 

 

データの切り替えボタンの作成方法

0. はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - サンプルモデル／ストーリーの作成 - SAP Communityで作成したストーリーを編集モードで開こう！

　0.1 ナビゲーションバーのファイルより作成したストーリーを開き、「編集」をクリックします。

 

 

1. メジャー入力コントロールを作成しよう

　1.1. 数値ポイントのチャートにメジャー入力コントロールを適用します。ビルダパネルを開きます。

 

　1.2. 一次値の「売上高」を削除します。

 

　1.3. 「少なくとも1メジャーが必要です」をクリックし、「+メジャー入力コントロールの追加」をクリックします。

 

　1.4. 利用可能なメンバーが表示されるので、チャート上で切り替えたいメジャーを選択します。今回は「すべてのメンバー」をクリックします。

 

　1.5. （任意）ディメンションが表示されるようにフィルタを伸ばします。

 

　1.6. メジャー入力コントロールを作成することができました。メジャー入力コントロールから「営業利益」を選択すると営業利益の数値ポイントが表示されていることが分かります。

 

　1.7. 同様に棒グラフにおいてもメジャー入力コントロールを作成します。

 

 

 

2. ディメンション入力コントロールを作成しよう

　2.1. 事業セグメントごとの売上高チャートにディメンション入力コントロールを適用します。ビルダパネルを開きます。

 

　2.2. ディメンションの「事業セグメント」を削除します。

 

　2.3. 「ディメンションの追加」をクリックし、「ディメンション入力コントロールの追加」を選択します。

 

　2.4. 利用可能なディメンションが表示されるので、チャート上で切り替えたいディメンションを選択します。今回は「すべてのディメンション」をクリックします。

 

　2.5. （任意）ディメンションが表示されるようにフィルタを伸ばします。

 

　2.6. ディメンション入力コントロールを作成することができました。ディメンション入力コントロールから「製品グループ」を選択すると製品グループごとの売上高が表示されていることが分かります。

 

今回はデータの切り替えボタンのご紹介でした。SAP Analytics Cloudは他にも様々な表現や便利な機能があり、本ブログシリーズでご紹介しています。はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - シリーズまとめ - SAP Communityからご参照ください。

entry.title: This Is the Way: Rethinking Analytics Orchestration with REST in SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Introduction

SAP Datasphere Task Chains have recently been enhanced with a new capability: the ability to add a REST API Step, as documented by SAP. This addition significantly expands the integration potential of Task Chains, allowing them to trigger or interact with external systems via REST APIs—something previously not possible within the task chain framework itself.

While SAP Datasphere already offers a Command Line Interface (CLI) for interacting with its environment, I believe that technical automation—especially triggering Task Chains—should be handled via REST endpoints wherever possible. (Yes, I am aware this is already on the roadmap.)

If you have followed the evolution of SAP Analytics Cloud, you have likely noticed how its REST API capabilities have grown considerably. This trend strongly suggests a broader strategic shift within SAP toward more API-driven architectures.
Beyond the technical implications, this new feature offers a glimpse into how future data and analytics architectures might be designed. The ability to call external REST APIs directly from within a Task Chain is a small yet significant change—it paves the way for loosely coupled, event-driven, and more modular system landscapes.

In this blog post, I will explore the broader implications of this feature—looking at both architectural perspectives and practical use cases—to illustrate how this seemingly simple addition might shape our thinking on modern data platform design going forward. The different implications and perspectives I will try to sketch out in this blog post.

Integration Perspective

With this new capability, you can invoke a REST service directly within a process step. What could such a REST service do? Here are a few examples:

  1. Microservices and Third-Party Data Sources - Trigger a microservice that extracts data from a third-party system and writes it into SAP Datasphere using the OPEN SQL schema.
  2.  Advanced Analytics on External Buckets - Initiate a predictive analytics process after data has been pushed to an external storage location (e.g., a Google Cloud Storage bucket), leveraging external computation power or models.
  3. Endless Possibilities - from orchestrating workflows to enriching data pipelines with external intelligence.

This simple yet powerful feature drastically lowers the barrier for integrating external systems. Especially in modern, heterogeneous IT landscapes, the ability to seamlessly interact with REST services is crucial. As solutions increasingly span multiple platforms and technologies, having native support for REST APIs within Task Chains enables more modular, scalable, and interoperable architectures.

SAC Seamless Planning Perspective

At present, Seamless Planning in SAP provides only a foundational set of features. However, even with these basic capabilities, it is now possible to trigger a Multi Action in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)—with some lightweight technical implementation, such as a microservice on SAP BTP to handle user propagation.

What Does This Enable?

It opens the door to scheduling planning-related actions that can be executed automatically—daily, during off-peak hours, or at custom intervals—all orchestrated directly from SAP Datasphere. This marks a significant step toward greater automation and operational efficiency in planning processes.

Looking ahead, the possibility of triggering a Task Chain from within a Multi Action (either via SAP’s upcoming official Task Chain Trigger feature or through a custom-built solution) would close the loop, enabling bi-directional process orchestration between SAC and Datasphere.

A Vision of Integration - Imagine this scenario:

  • Master data is loaded from an S/4HANA system into Datasphere (where the Master data may be managed in the future) and updated in the planning model.
  • Once this loading process is completed, a Data Action is automatically triggered to generate the necessary planning combinations.
  • Each step is orchestrated across systems—seamlessly integrating Datasphere and SAC.

This evolving capability points to a promising future, where SAP’s tools are moving toward more open, event-driven, and tightly connected architectures. It is a strong signal of the direction SAP is heading—toward building truly integrated, cross-platform planning and data ecosystems.

Process Orchestration

As outlined in the sections above, these new capabilities significantly enhance our ability to orchestrate analytics processes—in ways that were not possible just a few weeks ago. The integration of REST API steps and the evolving connectivity between SAP Datasphere and SAC unlocks a new level of flexibility.

What makes this particularly compelling is the ease with which we can now develop lightweight microservices on SAP BTP to support and extend these interactions. Whether it is handling authentication, user propagation, or orchestrating complex logic between systems, BTP provides a robust platform for embedding custom logic into an increasingly modular and responsive analytics architecture.

The On-Premises Thoughts

I have already referred several times to the concept of a “small microservice on SAP BTP.” This idea becomes especially relevant when you consider that SAP Datasphere is still often used alongside SAP BW, where orchestration tasks are traditionally handled via Process Chains and ABAP reports.

In many discussions—whether with internal teams or external consultants—there remains a strong inclination to implement logic directly within the ABAP stack of on-premise systems. This is understandable. It is what I would call the “home-field advantage”: familiarity, confidence, and reliability in an environment they know well. They’re certain it will work—but the question we must ask is: Will this remain a sustainable approach over the next 5 to 10 years?

The reality is that, SAP’s Business Data Cloud is on the rise, and the centrality of BW in analytics architectures is gradually diminishing. So why not embrace a more future proof approach?

By building a lightweight REST service on SAP BTP, we gain a flexible, scalable solution that can be triggered both by SAP BW and SAP Datasphere. This doesn’t just modernize our architecture—it lays the groundwork for future-proof integration patterns, better modularity, and easier maintenance in a cloud-centric world.

A broader architectural perspective

Another powerful dimension of this development is the ability to interact with a broader range of services available on SAP BTP, such as SAP Event Mesh. For example, you could emit an event to a queue and have that event trigger specific reactions among subscribed services. This pattern—similar to what has long been possible in SAP Data Intelligence using simple Pub/Sub mechanisms—enables a much cleaner, event-driven architecture that is better aligned with modern cloud-native design principles.

But this blog is not just about the “small” new feature of the REST API step. It is about what this feature represents: a clear signal of how the SAP Analytics ecosystem is rapidly evolving toward the Business Data Cloud—with SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP Databricks at its core (leaving SAP BW Private Cloud Edition aside for now).

This shift demands a mindset change for analytics consultants. To remain relevant and deliver robust solutions, we must go beyond our comfort zones and understand how SAP BTP enriches this ecosystem. That includes learning how to build with CAP or UI5, orchestrate processes using SAP Build, and embrace loosely coupled, service-based thinking.

It’s no longer just about reporting and data modeling—it's about understanding how to leverage the entire BTP toolset to design smarter, more flexible processes that are fit for the future.

Conclusion

The REST API step in SAP Datasphere Task Chains is much more than a technical enhancement—it is a strategic inflection point. It pushes SAP architecture toward:

  • Greater openness and interoperability
  • Microservice- and event-driven thinking
  • Tighter orchestration between SAC, Datasphere, and BTP
  • A cleaner transition from legacy on-prem ABAP logic

The future is modular, cloud-native, and integrated—and this is your chance to start designing for it.

entry.title: SAP Business Data Cloud Series – Part 1: Introduction to Data Products
entry.content:
Introduction:

Data products are the foundation of SAP Business Data Cloud, serving as the core building blocks of the platform. Each data product is a curated package of business process data and its associated semantics, metadata, harmonized and replicated from SAP applications like SAP S/4HANA, SAP Ariba, SAP SuccessFactors, SAP Concur, etc. SAP handles the entire replication process, ensuring data is reliable and consistent. For example, a Sales order data product contains mainly 2 entities, Sales order and Sales order item, and all relevant fields like order number, customer, product, quantity, and delivery date. Beyond raw table data (VBAK, VBAP) , metadata plays a critical role—it adds meaning, context, and relationships between data elements, such as linking a product to its supplier or defining its description in multiple languages.

This blog series explores:

  • What are data products? What are the data packages ?
  • Why do we need data products instead of tables ?
  • What types of data products exist? 
  • Difference between data products?
  • How to extend, create, or manage them?
  • What benefits do data products bring to your data strategy?
  1. SAP Business Data Cloud Series – Part 1: Introduction to Data Products.
  2. SAP Business Data Cloud Series – Part 2: Extend SAP S/4HANA Managed Data Products.
  3. SAP Business Data Cloud Series – Part 3: Customer-Managed Data Products Coming soon....

🔍What Are Data Products in SAP Business Data Cloud?

Data products are core building blocks within SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC). They are curated data sets that include both raw business data and rich metadata, harmonized and replicated from SAP source systems. These data products are designed to be easily consumable, reusable, and trusted sources of truth across analytical and business applications. Crucially, Data Products are fully governed and made available via APIs and a Data Product Directory, allowing them to be easily discovered and used across the organization.

Each data product is self-describing, meaning it includes not only the data itself but also metadata such as:

  • Interface definitions for data extraction
  • Delta-load capabilities
  • Technical documentation
  • Semantic and relationship details (e.g., Product ID with descriptions, supplier info, customer info, currency, unit of measure etc.)

🧱 Types of Data Products

SAP BDC supports three types of data products, based on ownership and development:

  • SAP-Managed Data Products: Delivered and maintained by SAP. These are standardized and regularly updated as the source application evolves.
  • Derived Data Products: Curated by SAP and built by leveraging existing Data Products.
  • Customer-Managed Data Products: Created by customers to suit their specific data needs.
    • Custom Data Products: Example would be created based on the Z CDS entities or non-SAP data loaded into the SAP Datasphere Object Store.
    • SAP BW Data Product Generator: SAP BW 7.5 or BW/4HANA Private Cloud feature, this pushes data to the SAP Datasphere Object Store. Created local tables can be shared as data products (Via Data sharing Cockpit).
  • Partner-Managed Data Products: Built by SAP partners, often tailored for industry-specific use cases.
  • 3rd Party Data Products: Built and managed by 3rd party partner. Delivered to SAP Datasphere tenants via Data Marketplace. Can be licensed for free or at cost defined by the 3rd party partner.

🔍 Key differences between SAP-Managed and Customer-Managed Data Products:

Both types of data products are technically the same, stored in an object store (HDLF), defined using an Open Resource Discover (ORD) JSON files, and published in the data catalog. However let us look at some key differences:

🔍 Aspect🟦 SAP-Managed Data Products🟩 Customer-Managed Data Products
👨‍💼 Ownership
  • Defined, Owned and Managed by SAP (complete life-cycle)
  • SAP manages data extraction, transformation, load, harmonization.
  • SAP manages metadata, business logic, semantics, associations, schemas and APIs.
  • Owned and Managed by Customer
  • Customer manages metadata, business logic, semantics,associations, schemas and APIs.
🏗️ CreationDelivered by SAP for SAP LoB ApplicationsBuilt by customers from any SAP/non-SAP data sources
🔄 UpdatesAutomatically updated by SAP (versioning)Updates controlled by the customer
🧭 GovernanceFully governed and aligned with SAP standardsGovernance defined by customer policies
🔗 ConnectivityReady-to-use with SAP source systems via BDC FormationsUsing SAP Datasphere Native Integrations, SAP BW Data Product Generator 
🗂️ Storage LayerSAP BDC FOS (Foundational Service) Layer i.e. HANA Data Lake Files (HDLFs)SAP Datasphere Object Store i.e HANA Data Lake Files (HDLFs)
🔍 DiscoverabilityPublished by SAP in Business Accelerator Hub or SAP BDC catalogCustomer need to list and publish it to the catalog.
⚙️ Use Cases
  • Best for standard analytics, planning, AI across SAP solutions like SAP S/HANA Cloud (Private/Public), SuccessFactors, Concur, Ariba etc.
  • Ready to consume SAP business application data
  • Intelligent Applications are built upon.
  • Custom analytics (non SAP Data)
  • SAP S/4HANA On-premise, ECC, Non-SAP data sources
  • SAP BW Data Product Generator
  • Unique business logic
  • Extension of Intelligent Applications
  • Local regulations, etc.

 

📦What is a Data Package?

Data products are grouped into Data Packages for easier discovery, deployment, and management. A data package may span multiple business domains, such as:  Billing Document,Sales Order, Sales Quotation etc.  This packaging enables users to activate, install and use related data products collectively.

e.g.: Data Package: SAP Sales Data Products (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition), contains multiple data products like Billing Document,Customer Return,Sales Order, Sales Quotation etc. Each data product can be build upon multiple entities e.g. 
Sales Order data product is based on the CDS entities Sales Order(I_SalesOrder) and Sales Order Item(I_SalesOrderItem).

 Where to find more details about SAP Data Products?

Navigate to Business Accelerator Hub -> Data Products -> Select the Product
 
 
Goto API reference for the source API or entities details.

High-level Workflow for the SAP Managed Data Product Activation:

Why use Data Products instead of direct tables for master or transaction raw data?

Unlike raw database tables that are often fragmented, inconsistent, and require heavy lifting for transformation and understanding, Data Products in SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) provide a ready-to-use, governed, and semantically rich abstraction of the data. These are:

  • Curated and harmonized: Built from SAP S/4HANA and other sources with standardized definitions and business rules.
  • Read-only and analytics-optimized: Designed for high-performance analytical workloads without risk of accidental changes.
  • Easily discoverable via the Data Product Directory and consumable through APIs.
  • Trustworthy: Certified with clear data lineage, ensuring users can rely on them across applications.
  • Reusable and composable: Multiple data products can be combined to build complex models, accelerating time to insights.
  • Enable self-service: Business users can access and explore data without deep technical knowledge, reducing dependency on IT.

By using Data Products, organizations achieve better data consistency, governance, faster decision-making, and agility, which is difficult to achieve with just raw tables.

Why must Data Products be stored on the Object Store (HDLFS) in SAP Business Data Cloud?

Data Products are stored in the object store (HDLFS) to support modern, scalable, and cost-efficient analytics use cases, particularly when dealing with high data volumes. Here's why:

  • Delta Table & Zero-Copy Share Support: Object store enables the use of Delta tables and the Delta Sharing protocol — a powerful, open-source mechanism that allows data sharing without copying or moving the data.
  • Efficient Storage via Data Lake: Unlike operational databases like SAP HANA (used for transactional workloads), a data lake is used in analytical environments to reduce storage costs. SAP Business Data Cloud leverages the SAP HANA Cloud Data Lake to store data as efficient files, not traditional tables.
  • Broader Tool Compatibility: File-based storage enables wider integration with various analytical and consumption tools, enhancing flexibility for downstream applications.
  • Scalable and Governed Sharing: With Delta Sharing, Data Products are exposed in a governed, scalable, and open manner, allowing users across the organization to securely consume up-to-date data — without duplication or manual transfers.

In short, storing Data Products on the object store ensures low-cost, high-scale, interoperable, and secure data sharing and analytics.

You can learn more about Delta Sharing here: https://delta.io

How to Consume and Activate SAP Managed Data Products ?

  • Activate Data Package.
  • Install Intelligent Application.
  • Provisioning of Business Data Cloud: Installation of Intelligent Applications and Data Packages

 

Summary:

In SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC), data products are curated, self-describing packages of business data that replace raw tables with harmonized, analytics-optimized datasets. SAP does the heavy lifting for customers by providing ready-to-use, SAP-managed data products out of the box for all Line of Business applications. This gives customer a trusted and governed data foundation, making it easy to build everything from BI reports to AI models while leveraging cost-effective, scalable storage for high-volume analytics. Happy Learning 🙂!

Further Resources or References:

  • https://help.sap.com/docs/business-data-cloud 
  • https://pages.community.sap.com/topics/business-data-cloud

entry.title: SAP Business Data Cloud Series – Part 2: Extend SAP S/4HANA Managed Data Products
entry.content:
Introduction:

In Part 1(SAP Business Data Cloud Series – Part 1: Introduction to Data Products) of this blog series, we explored the fundamentals of Data Products in SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC). Now, in Part 2, we dive into the practical aspect of extending SAP-managed Data Products, specifically, how to incorporate custom Y/Z fields into the standard SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Managed Data Products. If you have already enhanced the underlying CDS views or entities in your SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition (PCE) system before activating the corresponding data package or installing the intelligent application, the good news is that your custom fields will automatically flow into the Data Product upon activation. No additional steps required!

In this article, we’ll walk through a common extension scenario involving Sales Order and Billing/Invoice CDS views or SAP Data Products:

 

Data ProductData Source CDS
Sales OrderI_SalesOrder
Sales Order ItemI_SalesOrderItem
Billing Document ItemI_BillingDocumentItemDEX
 

Steps to Extend SAP S/4HANA Managed Data Products Using Key User Extensibility

1. Set Up Adaptation Transport Organizer (ATO): As a prerequisite, ensure ATO is configured to support key user extensions in your system.

2. Add Custom Fields via SAP Fiori App: Open the Custom Fields and Logic app in SAP Fiori and create the required Y/Z custom fields.

How to find business context? Use Tcode: SCFD_REGISTRY

Select Business Context for SD_SALESDOC for Sales Document (Order) and SD_SALESDOCITEM for Sales Document Item.

Similarly  select Business Context SD_BILLINGDOCITEM for Billing Document Item 

Fill the custom field technical details like label, id, data type etc.

3. Publish Custom Fields:After creating the fields, publish them. This step will automatically append your custom fields to the underlying SAP standard ABAP tables.

Publish the field, below one is shown for CampaignID which is added to billing document item.

Likewise it can be done for Sales order (ZZ1_Custom1) and Sales order item (ZZ1_Custom2) custom fields extension.

After above steps custom fields should be appended to standard ABAP tables: VBAK, VBAP and VBRP in our scenario.

VBAK:

 VBAP:

VBRP:

4. Extend the CDS Views or Entities :Enhance the relevant CDS views/entities to include the newly created custom fields.
If the CDS view is listed in the Extensibility Registry (T-code: SCFD_REGISTRY), use Data Source Extensions, this is the recommended approach before resorting to manual CDS view or entity extensions, as demonstrated below.
Alright, we will use CDS extension to include the added and published custom fields:

4.1: Extend CDS View I_SalesOrder to include ZZ_CUSTOM1 field. You can also view the data definitions which got created, when custom fields where published using the Fiori App Custom Fields and Logic.

@AbapCatalog.sqlViewAppendName:  'ZEXTSALESORDER'
@EndUserText.label: 'Extension View for I_SalesOrder'
extend view I_SalesOrder with ZEXTEND_SALESORDER
{
ZZ1_Custom1_SDH as ZZ_CUSTOM1
}

Once extension view is activated, you can now test the CDS extractor/view (SE16N):

4.2: Extend CDS View I_SalesOrderItem to include ZZ1_CUSTOM2 field. You can also view in the Eclipse ADT perspective, what CDS extensions have been created for the CDS view, click on the spiral icon.

@AbapCatalog.sqlViewAppendName:  'ZEXTSALESORDITEM'
@EndUserText.label: 'Extension View for I_SalesOrderItem'
extend view I_SalesOrderItem with ZEXTEND_SALESORDERITEM
{
ZZ1_Custom2_SDI as ZZ1_Custom2
}

Click on spiral icon:

4.3: Extend CDS Entity I_BillingDocumentItemDEX to include ZZ_CampaignID field. 
Note: In previous scenarios, we extended CDS views; in this case, we are extending a CDS entity. CDS entity does not have SQL view created.

extend view entity I_BillingDocumentItemDEX with
{
  _Extension.ZZ1_CampaignID_BDI as ZZ_CampaignID

}

5. Validate Data in CDS Views/Entities: Test the extended CDS views to confirm that the custom fields are populated with data (assuming relevant business logic is in place and transactional data has been updated). e.g. For Sales Order extension use released BAdIs enhancement spot ES_SD_SLS_EXTEND, classic ABAP has user-exit MV45AFZZ (this is out of scope for this blog).

In previous using SE16N we validated that fields are populated on the extended views or entities. 

6. Activate the Data Package in the SAP BDC Cockpit :Proceed to activate the related data package that uses the extended CDS views and has data products of interest.
Note: SAP-managed Data products cannot be activated individually. They only can be activated via Intelligent Application or on data package level. That means that all the data products within the data package or Intelligent Application are activated in one step.

Data Package: SAP Sales Data Products( SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition) has the Data Products 1.Sales Order and 2. Billing Documet.

Once you activate the data package, on the SAP S/4HANA side you can check in the Tcode DHADM for subscription, data replication etc.

Transfer jobs overview:

 

APRS is pushing to target HANA Data Lake Files i.e. SAP BDC Foundational services (FOS) layer.

Target HDLF file path:

Give some time based on the data volume of the data products for the data package to become active. 

7. Install the Data Product: Install the SAP-managed data product corresponding to the activated data package.
Currently, Delta-Share or zero-copy works only with Databricks. In SAP Datasphere, these data products are replicated from the FOS layer into the SAP Datasphere Ingestion Space (SAP managed). In the future, SAP Datasphere will also support Delta-Share.

Prerequisite step:  Add space WS_IT so that you can install the data product (via sharing from the system ingestion space).

Next, we will install data products into the SAP Datasphere WS_IT Space (User Modeling Space).
This process creates a data product share from the SAP-managed Ingestion Space to the user-managed WS_IT Space in our scenario.

Go to SAP Datasphere → Catalog & Marketplace.

Data Access Type:

Remote Tables: By default, data is only federated (delta-share) from from FOS layer into SAP Datasphere Ingestion space. . Output: Remote table.

 Replication flow to Local Tables: data is replicated from from FOS layer into SAP Datasphere Ingestion space. Output: Local table(delta-enabled) and Replication flow.

Choose the required option as per the business requirement, as data federation may degrade performance. 

Now, we have successfully installed the Data Products.

8. Preview Data in Local Table: Finally, preview the data within the Data Product’s local table to confirm that the custom fields are available and populated with the data.
We can view in the WS_IT space, all the data products are installed (shared).

If we click on Billing Document Item data product, then it will navigate to SAP managed Datasphere Ingestion Space RI4400(SAP-Managed).

Great, the data products, now enhanced with your custom (Z) fields, have been successfully installed and are ready for to be used in Datasphere modeling or delta-share with Databricks.

Q: We need to extend an already installed data product. How should we handle this situation?

A: Currently, when you need to extend or change an existing data product, the process On the SAP S/4HANA source side, any changes you make will be handled within the existing framework. On the SAP BDC side, however, you must either deactivate the entire data package or uninstall the intelligent application and then activate or reinstall it to incorporate the new changes to the data product. It is not the most efficient way to handle a small change of adding new field to the data product. The product team is aware of this and is working on a solution to provide more granular control at the data product level, which would allow for more targeted updates in the future.

Summary:

In this blog, we saw how to extend SAP S/4HANA Managed Data Products by adding custom fields and making them available in SAP Business Data Cloud, SAP Datasphere. We learned how to use the Custom Fields and Logic app, extend CDS entities, and replicate the updated data by data product activation. Things are improving and getting rapidly in the product, and I will do my best to keep this blog updated with the latest changes. Happy Learning 🙂!

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud - New (Measure Based) Model with Account Dimension – Part 2
entry.content:
Introduction

In the previous blog, we discussed how to create the model and save it.

In this blog, we will explore how to populate the data in the model.

Step 1: - Select Data Management under the Workspace section from the tool bar.

Step 2: - Click on the import icon as highlighted in the screenshot below.

Step 3: - Select a data source — in my case, I’m choosing File since I’ll be importing a file from my system.

Step 4: - Click on 'Select Source File' to import the desired file into the application.

Step 5: - Select the desired file from your system — in this case, the Sales Data file.

Step 6: - After selecting the file the system will automatically import data as shown below. If the file contains multiple worksheets choose the appropriate sheet. If applicable enable the 'First Row as Column Headers otherwise manually define the column headers in the configuration stage.

After completing this steps, click on the 'Import' button to proceed.

Step 7: - After clicking the 'Import' button, the imported file will appear in the 'Import Jobs' section. To initiate the configuration process, click on the 'Set Up Import' option.

Step 8: - Prepare Data Stage

The key task involves previewing the data, defining the dimensions and measures, to set column headers, transformation of data, creating calculated columns if needed and build hierarchy.

Click the 'Next' button once all tasks are completed. In this case, since all dimensions and measures are correctly configured with the appropriate data types, you can proceed to the next step.

Step 9: - Map To Facts Stage

Here, we can see that a few source columns are not fully mapped, so drag and drop the 'Month' column into the unmapped section and assign 'Date' as the target.

Most of the columns are already mapped correctly to the respective targets. Though the Mapped section has 'Default Version', on the other hand the source contains an unmapped 'Version' column. To correct this, first we remove the 'Default Version' from the Mapping section and add the 'Version' column from the source.

This is done because the 'version' column contains data specific to 'public.actual'.

After mapping, a pop-up appears to confirm the completion of mapping.

We can see that two columns remain unmapped in the source section and will be mapped in the following stage.

Click on the Next button.

Step 10: - Map Properties Stage

Map the 'Category' column from the source section to Dimension Properties of Version and it is mandatory step that cannot be skipped to specify the version types.

It is mandatory for a Private Account Dimensions to map the 'Hierarchy' column whereas not required for Public Dimensions.

In my case, I am using Private Account Dimensions so I will be mapping the 'Hierarchy' column from the source to the Dimension Property of Account.

After mapping the 'Hierarchy' column, you will see that no source columns remain to be mapped. The Next button will be enabled once all mandatory columns are mapped. Click the ‘Next’ button to move to the next stage.

Note: If some source columns are still unmapped, it may be because the target structure doesn’t include them. It’s not necessary to map every source column—only the mandatory ones.

Step 11: - Review Import Stage

In the Map to Facts stage, click the Next button to begin the data validation process. The system will automatically validate the data before import, checking for any issues such as missing mandatory field mappings, data type mismatches, structural restrictions, or data quality problems.

If no issues are found during validation, the Run Import button will become enabled, allowing you to proceed. If validation errors are detected, the system will display an error message or a validation summary outlining the issues that need to be addressed. You must correct all identified problems before continuing.

Once validation is successful, click the Run Import button to start importing the data.

Note: It is not mandatory to map all source columns—only the required fields need to be mapped. Optional columns can remain unmapped if they are not part of the target structure.

When the Run Import process is initiated, a pop-up window appears prompting you to configure the import settings. In this case, no changes are required, so the default settings are used, with the import method set to Update. However, these settings can be modified based on specific requirements, such as choosing a different import method or adjusting validation options. Once the appropriate settings are confirmed, click the Finish button to proceed with the import.

After clicking the Finish button, the status of the import job can be viewed in the Data Management workspace, as shown below.

Step 12: - To preview the data that has been imported into the model structure, navigate to the Model Structure workspace.

Summary

We have created the hybrid model combining both Measure and Account dimensions by understanding how to map the source and target fields along with their properties and then validated the data using Import setting. Then successfully previewed the data using model structure.

Please refer to previous blog - SAP Analytics Cloud - New (Measure Based) Model with Account Dimension - Part 1 .

Thank you for taking the time to read my blog—I hope you found it helpful! If you did, please like, share, and leave a comment.

Stay safe and stay curious!

entry.title: AI-Assisted Chart Summary in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
We are thrilled to announce the General Availability of the AI-Assisted Chart Summary feature in SAP Analytics Cloud, add-in for Microsoft PowerPoint.
This new powerful capability is available as part of the Q3 2025 release.

 

What Is It?

The AI-Assisted Chart Summary leverages generative AI to automatically generate concise, human-readable summaries of SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) charts embedded in your PowerPoint presentations. Whether you're preparing for a meeting or sharing insights with stakeholders, this feature helps you communicate key takeaways faster and more clearly.

 

 

 

Benefits

  • Save Time: No more manually interpreting charts and writing manual summaries. AI-assisted chart summary delivers generated summary in seconds.
  • Enhance Clarity and boost accessibility: Summaries are crafted in natural language, making complex data accessible to everyone
  • Accelerate Decisions: By surfacing trends and key points instantly, users can act faster and smarter.
  • Stay Current: Summaries can be regenerated on demand to reflect any changes in the underlying chart data, ensuring your insights are always up to date.

 

How It Works

When working in SAC add-in for Microsoft PowerPoint, simply select a chart and click on “Generate Summary” button. The generated text is inserted in the current slide as an editable comment, allowing you to tailor the message if needed. And if your data changes? Just regenerate the summary with a click—no need to start from scratch.

 

 

 

Licensing & Availability

This feature is part of the broader AI-Assisted Features suite in SAC and requires:

  • A valid SAC license (BI or Planning)
  • An AI Units SKU contract

AI Units are consumed as the feature is used. Pricing and consumption details are available via the SAP Business AI Catalog.

 

Thanks for your interest. We hope you will enjoy using this new capability and look forward to your feedback.

entry.title: AI-Assisted Calculations in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
We’re thrilled to announce the arrival of AI-Assisted Calculations in SAP Analytics Cloud—a transformative new feature designed to enhance your interaction with data. As part of our broader "AI First" strategy, this innovation harnesses generative AI to revolutionize how you create and comprehend complex calculations within the Calculation Dialog in SAP Analytics Cloud’s Data Analyzer, streamlining your data workflows and boosting analytical efficiency.

What Is It? 

AI-Assisted Calculations consists of two key functionalities within the calculation dialog: Generate and Explain. The Generate functionality simplifies the process of creating calculations by allowing you to use natural language to create a new calculation. The Explain functionality helps you understand existing calculations by providing a clear, natural language explanation. 

Key Benefits 

  1. Accelerate Calculation Creation: Instantly generate complex formulas using natural language queries, significantly reducing the time required for creating calculations and speeding up your workflow. 
  2. Simplify Calculation Understanding: Use the "Explain" feature to translate existing formulas into simple, easy-to-understand language, facilitating quick comprehension of complex calculations from colleagues or your own work. 
  3. Enhance User Experience: Leverage AI to simplify formula creation and explanation, making data analysis more intuitive and user-friendly, with future enhancements to resolve formula errors efficiently. 

How It Works

Generating a Calculation

The Generate functionality is a game-changer, allowing users to create complex calculations by simply describing what they need, rather than manually constructing formulas.

  1. In the Create Calculation or Edit Calculation dialog, open AI-Assisted Calculations. 
  2. In the formula requirement field, type your request using natural language. For example: "Calculate the Gross Margin Ratio" or "I need a formula to flag percentage values that deviate from the budget by more than 6%." 

  3. Click Generate. The AI will display a generated formula that you can review. 

  4. Once you're satisfied with the result, click Copy to Formula to use it in your calculation. 

Tip: For optimal accuracy in your calculations, provide clear and detailed requirements. Specify the exact dimensions and measures, and identify the specific members you are referring to. This precision will enhance the reliability of the generated calculations. 

Explaining a Calculation

The Explain functionality is perfect for understanding complex formulas created by others or refreshing your memory on your own work. 

  1. In the Edit Calculation dialog, the formula will appear in both the editor and the AI-Assisted Calculations tab. 
  2. Click Explain in the AI-Assisted Calculations. 
  3. The assistant will provide a clear, natural-language explanation of what the formula does. 

 This is especially helpful for understanding the business purpose behind a calculation and can be used to write a better description for the calculation itself, or just to understand it. 

Prerequisites 

This feature is part of the broader AI-Assisted Features suite in SAC and requires: 

  • A valid SAC license (BI or Planning) 
  • Business AI. See SAP Note 0003491182 . 
  • You must have purchased the SAP AI Units license. Please read the SAP Business AI catalog for more information, including factors for converting usage into SAP AI Units 
  • You must have the Execute permission for the Generative AI privilege. 

You can check that you have met all the necessary prerequisites, including activating the feature, as detailed here. . 

Looking Forward

This functionality will soon be available in the calculation editor within Story in SAP Analytics Cloud through the new Calculation Dialog. It holds immense potential for broader SAC implementations, especially where automated calculation creation is needed. We are committed to enhancing user workflows through continuous improvements and welcome your feedback and collaboration as part of our AI First strategy for SAC.

Thank you for your interest in AI-Assisted Calculations. We hope this new capability enhances your data analytics experience and invite your insights and feedback.

entry.title: Harnessing SAP Analytics Cloud AI Assisted Advanced Formula Generation Capabilities in QRC3.2025
entry.content:
Harnessing SAP Analytics Cloud AI Assisted Advanced Formula Generation Capabilities in QRC3.2025

We are pleased to announce the release of AI assisted advanced formula generation capabilities in our QRC3.2025 release.  SAP Analytics Cloud provides planners the ability to leverage artificial intelligence (AI) to create advanced formulas scripts and script comments within the advanced formulas step of a data actions.  Please browse the SAP Business AI catalog for more business value information and pricing details.

Prerequisites

Check that you have met all the necessary prerequisites, which includes activating the feature, which is detailed here.

 

Key benefits

The goal of this enhancement is to make advanced formulas scripting more accessible to the planner and to accelerate their productivity by:

  1. Simplifying the creation of technical scripts – use business comments to guide AI to generate a technical script
  2. Documenting technical scripts – Select a technical script and have AI generate a comment to explain the calculation in business terms.

Basics of AI-Generated Scripts and Comments

To generate scripts or script-comments using AI, planners will also require to meet the requirements to be able to create/edit advanced formulas.  AI can assist in generating scripts by translating business comments into technical scripts. Similarly, it can generate clear business comments based on existing technical scripts. During script/comment generation, the AI offers suggestions which appear highlighted to indicate they are generated and prompts users to either accept or reject the output. Notably, all generated scripts and script comments include a cautionary note to verify results before use, underscoring the importance of human oversight to manage the overall process.

 

Tips for Effective Usage

When generating advanced formula scripts from a business comment, it's beneficial to be specific as possible using specific members/dimensions names to make it easier for the AI accurately to understand the request. It is advisable, however, not to base script generation solely on the AI-generated comments since these may not capture every technical detail appropriately.  Generated scripts may benefit from a human technical review and testing to validate the logic and make any minor script adjustments as needed that were not captured by the original prompt.

For script comment generation, focusing on a single line of a formula script might yield the most detailed insights. Likewise, if the formula script selection is large, the AI provides more generalized comments to document the script.

Explore With Examples

The platform also provides examples of both script and comment generations, assisting users in understanding how AI interprets various scenarios and implements solutions. These examples range from basic arithmetic optimizations in financial data to looping through dimensions for iterative calculations.

 Generating Comment from Advanced Formulas Script

Generate Advanced Formulas Script from a comment

In Conclusion

Whether you're a seasoned data analyst or new to SAP Analytics Cloud, integrating AI into your workflow will significantly enhance your ability to efficiently generate advanced formula scripts and script comments.

entry.title: How to use SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Unit Estimator?
entry.content:
**Updated August 2025**

Welcome to our blog series focused on the SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Unit Estimator. 

This guide provides a comprehensive, step-by-step approach to help you estimate the capacity units (CU) needed for your business case (before purchasing) or how you can distribute them across your solution components (after signing a contract).

Remember that BDC is available only through the subscription commercial model, which means you pay a fixed price for a specific quantity of CU and sign a contract with SAP. The price varies on how many CU you need.

Furthermore, once licensed, BDC offers flexibility in quota assignment. This means that, if you need to allocate more CU to SAP Datasphere, you can reduce the number of licenses in SAP Analytics Cloud and SAP Databricks, and also the other way around*. If you want to change the quota assignment, read more here.

This series has 4 parts as follows: 

  • SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Unit Estimator (this post)
  • SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Unit Estimator for SAP Analytics Cloud 
  • SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Unit Estimator for SAP Datasphere (coming soon)
  • SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Unit Estimator for SAP Databricks (coming soon)

What's SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Unit Estimator? This estimator tool helps you calculate the number of capacity units required for each SAP BDC capacity service, as well as the total amount needed.

What are capacity units? Capacity Units (CU) are the metric used to allocate storage and compute resources within the BDC solution. The criteria for calculating CU vary depending on the service component:

  • For SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), CU differs by license type and corresponding quantities (SAC Test, SAC Business Intelligence, SAC Planning Standard, or SAC Planning Professional)
  • For SAP Datasphere, CU depends on multiple factors such as Data Lake usage, storage, memory, and more
  • For SAP Databricks, CU is based on various measures including storage, serverless SQL compute, SAP Object Store requests, and more.

SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Unit Estimator Home Screen

* Note: This does not apply to SAP Business Warehouse Private Cloud Edition, as its capacity unit quota is determined by your contract with SAP. Also, for SAP Databricks, although you assign a quota amount, usage can exceed this number since billing is based on actual consumption rather than the assigned quota.

Source: Administer SAP Business Data Cloud

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud Q3 2025 Release
entry.content:
SAP has officially rolled out its Q3 2025 release for SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) and it brings exciting new features that make working with data easier and faster.

  • Home Page Renewal: Personalized Productivity : The SAC home page has been completely redesigned to enhance user experience and productivity. New interface makes it easier than ever to navigate SAC and stay focused on what matters most. Key highlights include:
    • Customizable layout tailored to individual workflows
    • Quick access to: 
      • JustAsk (natural language query assistant)
      • Guided learning paths
      • Recent and featured files
      • Calendar highlights
  • AI-Assisted Features: AI deeply into SAC with several new capabilities:
    • Advanced Formula Generation -
      • Use natural language comments to generate complex formulas.
      • Automatically create descriptions for existing scripts.
      • Ideal for data actions and planning models.
    • AI-Assisted Commenting -
      • Summarize, translate, and rephrase comments in tables / story.
    • Chart Summary for PowerPoint -
      • Generate presentation-ready summaries of charts.
      • Save time and improve communication of insights.
    • Natural Language Calculations -
      • Define calculations in Data Analyzer using plain language.
  • Data Analyzer Enhancements: The Data Analyzer now supports:
    • Scheduling of reports
    • Color highlighting for better readability
    • Hyperlink integration into stories
    • New calculation options for deeper analysis
  • Better modeling Tools : Modeling in SAC is now more powerful and secure as -
    • New aggregation exception types for advanced logic
    • Conditional validation to ensure data quality
    • Data security-based display: restrict data visibility based on user roles.
  • Story building made easier:
    • New table builder experience with undo/redo
    • Arrow indicators to visually represent positive/negative values
    • Performance recommendations tab to optimize story performance.
  • System Administration Updates: 
    • SAP BTP cockpit integration for planning data storage.
    • Enhanced SSO (Single Sign-On) for easier access across SAP products

Reference : What's New in SAP Analytics Cloud | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - 差異の表示
entry.content:
本ブログシリーズはSAP Analytics CloudのBI機能を使ってダッシュボードやレポートの作成を行う方を対象とし、SAP Analytics CloudのBIにおける基本の操作やTipsをハンズオン形式でご紹介します。

本ブログでは、ストーリーにて予実差異を表示したい！前年度差異をぱっとわかるようにしたい！といった方向けに、以下のようにチャートやテーブルにおいて差異を表示する方法についてご紹介します。

目次：

  • SAP Analytics Cloudにおける差異表示
  • チャートでの差異の追加方法［ハンズオン］
  • テーブルでの差異の追加方法［ハンズオン］

※ベースとなるサンプルストーリーの作成手順は、はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - サンプルモデル／ストーリーの作成 - SAP Communityでご紹介しています。

※ SAP Analytics Cloudは、四半期に１度のペースで製品のバージョンアップが実施されます。そのため今後のバージョンアップにより、本ブログで紹介する画面キャプチャや、操作が異なる可能性があることをご了承ください。（本ブログは2025年5月に作成しています。）

SAP Analytics Cloudにおける差異表示

SAP Analytics Cloudにおける差異表示は大きく2種類：チャートでの差異表示とテーブルでの差異計算列の追加による表示があります。

チャートでの差異表示では、複数のバージョン間での差異、または複数の期間における差異を値またはパーセントで表示することができます。差異の表現方法は、チャートによってデータラベルや累積、棒グラフやウォーターフォールなど、見たい形によって使い分けることができます。

【画像】
詳細はヘルプページをご覧ください：チャートに対する差異の追加 | SAP Help Portal

テーブルでの差異計算列の追加による表示では、XXX
【画像】
詳細はヘルプページをご覧ください：（ヘルプリンク）

チャートでの差異の追加方法［ハンズオン］

0. (リンク)で作成したストーリーを編集モードで開こう！

0.1. ナビゲーションバーのファイルより作成したストーリーを開き、「編集」をクリックします。

1. 数値ポイントのチャートに、前年度との差異を追加しよう！

※2025年Q3より数値ポイントのUIが変わりました。本ブログは変更前の画像になります。

1.1. 数値ポイントチャートをクリックした上、右パネル（ビルダパネル）を開きます。

1.2. （2025年の第2四半期にフィルタをかけます。）「＋フィルタの追加」をクリックします。

1.3. 「Data（メンバー）」をクリックします。

1.4. 「2025」を展開して「Q2」を選択し、「OK」をクリックします。（2025年の第2四半期にフィルタがかかりました。）

1.5. ビルダパネルの「チャートアドオン」を展開し、「差異」をクリックします。

1.6. 「＋バージョン/時間の追加」をクリックします。

1.7. 「Date」を選択します。（今回は前年度差異のためDateを選択しましたが、予実差異の場合はバージョンを選択します。）

1.8. TO (B)の時間にて、「前の時間間隔」の「ｖ」をクリックします。

1.9. 「前年度」を選択します。（これにより、2025Q1との比較から2024Q2との比較に変更されました。）

1.10. 表示オプションの差異の表示形式を「パーセント」に変更し、右下の「処理済み」をクリックします。

1.11. 前年度差異を％で表すチャートが完成しました！

2. 棒チャートに、予算と実績の差異を追加しよう！

 2.1.数値ポイントチャートをクリックした上、右パネル（ビルダパネル）を開きます。

2.2. 色の「＋ディメンション/メジャーの追加」をクリックします。

2.3. 「バージョン」を選択します。

2.4. 「＋バージョンの追加」をクリックし、「Budget」を選択します。（チャートに実績と予算の両方が表示されました。）

2.5.  ビルダパネルの「チャートアドオン」を展開し、「差異」をクリックします。


2.6. 「＋バージョン/時間の追加」をクリックします。

 2.7. 「バージョン」を選択します。

2.8. 表示オプションの差異の表示形式を「パーセント」に変更し、右下の「処理済み」をクリックします。

2.9. 予実差異を％で確認できるチャートが完成しました！
 

 

 

テーブルでの差異の追加方法［ハンズオン］

3. テーブルにXXX

 

今回は差異チャートのご紹介でした。SAP Analytics Cloudは他にも様々な表現や便利な機能があり、本ブログシリーズでご紹介しています。（まとめ）のリンクからご参照ください。

entry.title: SAP分析云中新的表构建体验
entry.content:
随着SAP分析云 2025年第三季度QRC版本的发布，我们很高兴向大家介绍全新的表生成器面板，使表设计流程与统计图和地理可视化对象流程更加一致，简化故事创建。这一新功能已于8月中旬陆续在客户的 SAP 分析云中上线。 

在这篇博客中，我们将重点介绍强调关键的分析增强，这些内容将细分为以下几个部分： 

  1. 虚化表 
  2. 新的生成器面板 
  3. 功能性增强 

对于新的生成器面板中与计划相关的更新,查看Improved Input Readiness and Unbooked Data Display in SAP Analytics Cloud.获取相关内容。 

 

虚化表 

当添加新表或者出现错误状态时，虚化表就会出现。在初始创建时，这会阻止不必要的查询被处理并让设计器选择所需的对象, 确保提供一致且有引导的体验。我们还针对循环依赖、实体缺失等情况，引入了更优的错误处理机制。 

对于SAP BW查询，该表会自动继承基础查询的布局、筛选器和设置。 

 

新的生成器面板 

我们介绍了新的生成器面板，使表构建体验与图表和地理可视化功能体验一致，以下是面板包括的一些增强: 

  1. “可用对象”面板 
  2. 灵活的总计和父节点定位 
  3. 改进的对象选择下拉列表 
  4. 新的成员选择器 
  5. 表加载项 
  6. 表格样式的单一来源 

 

可用对象面板 

新的表格生成器面板引入了打开“可用的对象”的列表选项，从而可以查看数据模型的完整结构和对象，以下是包括一些好处： 

  1. 更流畅、无间断的设计体验，可访问完整的对象列表 
  2. 通过拖放操作或更多操作图标（即“添加到列”或“添加到行”）轻松添加对象 
  3. 通过对象列表中的直观图标，清晰识别维度类型 

 

灵活的总计和父节点定位 

我们已从集中式的“显示总计和父级位置”设置转变为对行和列的独立控制，使设计人员能够更灵活地根据需求定制表格布局。

 

改进的对象选择下拉列表 

我们已优化了主次要结构成员的选择流程。用户现在可以直接从下拉菜单中选择单个成员，而无需使用成员选择器。该菜单已扩展至生成器面板的整个宽度，从而更便于定位和选择所需的成员。 

设计人员可以继续使用成员选择器，对主结构和次结构进行更高级别的成员选择。 

 

新成员选择器的集成 

设计人员在创建本地筛选器或选择主次结构时，现可利用新成员选择器提升效率。当检测到输入控件时，系统将为​​主结构和辅助结构​​显示多标签布局，从而简化元素选择操作。 

此外，​​主结构筛选器（账户或度量）​​ 的功能支持已扩展至非 SAP BW 模型，进一步扩展了其适用性。 

 

表加载项 

通过新增​​专用加载项区域​​（与统计图和地理可视化体验一致），我们显著提升了表格加载项的可发现性，包括​​单元格内统计图​​、​​链接分析​​、​​超链接​​及​​阈值​​等功能。 

同时引入​​专用单元格内统计图面板​​，用户可在此面板内集中配置所有单元格内统计图设置。原位于样式面板的选项（如​​显示数据值​​和​​轴线颜色​​）现移至该新面板，使设计体验更流畅且操作更便捷。 

 

样式相关属性统一展示

自适应列宽​​功能已从生成器面板迁移，​​单位/货币显示​​设置则从数字格式选项移至样式面板下表属性中的中心位置。 

 

功能增强 

通过全新的生成器面板，我们引入了多项功能增强，显著提升了表格可视化的创建与定制效率。具体改进包括: 

  1. 排名与排序优化​​ 
  2. ​​报表至报表接口增强​​ 
  3. ​​混合表改进​​ 
  4. ​​版本维的灵活性 
  5. ​​显示/隐藏阈值提示详情​​ 
  6. ​​分层多选主结构输入控件​​ 
  7. ​​新增客户端计算面板​​ 

 

排名与排序优化​​ 

​​表格的排序和排名功能已全面升级，赋予用户更灵活的操控能力： 

表中的排序不再依赖于版本。当维度同时置于行与列时，用户可自由选择对行或列进行排序，并指定排序依据的维度成员。此外，“保持左列分组”已重命名为“断开分组”，以与统计图术语保持一致。 

对于排名，“创建 Top N”（Create Top N）更名为​​排名​​（Rank），与统计图功能命名统一，支持： 

  1. ​​跨多维度排名 
  2. 对 ​​SAP BW 特性中折叠的层级结构进行排名 

 

报表至报表接口增强​​ 

对于SAP BW 实时连接​​，“jump to”菜单现可支持更多目标类型，包括 ​​Web Dynpro​​、​​ABAP 报表​​及​​自定义 (BAdIs)​​ 

你也可以导航到更广泛的单元格类型（如​​表头单元格​​和​​总计单元格​​）。

 

混合表改进 

混合表功能现在在新的生成器面板中支持，有一些关键的改进： 

  1. 支持排序与排名功能
  2. 支持 ​​SAP BW 数据​​的文本描述格式（​​短文本​​、​​中文本​​、​​长文本​​） 
  3. 应用条件​​功能现可用于 ​​SAP BW 模型​​ 

注意:不支持从经典故事中迁移混合表至优化故事体验，优化故事体验中的混合表格中​​必须至少包含一个关联维度。

版本维的灵活性 

用户现可删除应用于表格的默认的版本筛选器，且无需强制添加一个单值筛选器。此功能为​​计划人员​​提供灵活性，使可视化组件能动态更新以反映单个或多个版本的数据。 

故事设计者需确保表格满足以下至少一项条件以正常显示数据： 

  1. ​​添加版本维度至表格​​（例如置于行或轴）； 
  2. ​​通过单值筛选器限定版本​​（可通过本地筛选器、故事筛选器、页面筛选器或关联分析实现）； 
  3. ​​采用​作用于版本维度的受限制的主结构​​（账户或度量）​​或次要结构​​。 

 

显示/隐藏阈值提示详情​​ 

对于表格中显示的阈值，现提供​​显示/隐藏阈值提示信息详情​​的灵活性选项。此功能允许隐藏阈值​​、阈值名称、范围和条状图信息。 

 

分层多选主结构输入控件​​ 

我们已扩展​​主结构输入控件的功能，支持额外的选择类型：多选、单选层级和多选层级。采用新的成员选择器提供统一的操作体验。表格现支持使用​​多选​​和​​多选层级​​输入控件（除单选和单选层级外），赋予设计者更大灵活性，以构建动态且用户驱动的表格。 

现有输入控件的配置将保持不变。但一旦编辑并确认后，系统会​​自动更新为新输入控件格式​​。 

注意：统计图和地理可视化​​不支持多选或多选层级​​输入控件，若强行使用将导致报错。 

 

新增客户端计算面板​ 

我们推出了​​客户端计算面板​​，帮助设计者轻松管理表中使用的计算项。设计者可通过该面板选择相应操作，快速​​格式化​​、​​编辑​​或​​删除​​计算项。 

本次发布仅是起点。我们将持续改进，使表格更具​​动态性​​、​​交互性​​和​​可定制性​​，突破 SAP分析云在企业决策与洞察分析中的能力边界。一如既往，您的反馈将持续影响产品路线图，我们期待与您共同进化，重塑表格驱动企业级决策与洞察的无限可能。 

敬请期待，更多精彩即将到来！ 

 

SAP分析云新的表构建体验文档 

如需查看新的表生成器当前所有限制，请参考原文中的官方文档 

原文链接：The New Table Building Experience in SAP Analytics... - SAP Community

原作者：Tunir

entry.title: SAP Datasphere & Python : One click to export data of multiple views in Excel/CSV
entry.content:
Introduction

Currently, SAP Datasphere only allows data export through Analytical Models. That means for every fact view, one has to create a separate Analytical Model just to download the data. It’s not ideal, especially when you have many views. Exporting them one by one becomes slow and repetitive.

To solve this,  Python script was developed that connects to SAP Datasphere, runs a query on each view from list, and saves the results as Excel files in a local drive path which is predefined. Now  just run the script, and it exports everything in one go—no manual effort needed.

Requirements 

Before running the script, install the following Python packages:

These packages enable secure connectivity to SAP Datasphere and support efficient data handling.

pip install hdbcli
pip install sqlalchemy
pip install sqlalchemy-hana

Creating a Database User in SAP Datasphere

To enable Python connectivity, create a database user:

  1. Navigate to Space Management in SAP Datasphere
  2. Select the relevant space
  3. Click on Database Access
  4. Create a new user with read access
  5. Copy the host, port, username, and password

Helpful links : Create DB User in Datasphere Space  

Python Script

# 📦 Install required packages (run these in your terminal or notebook)
# pip install hdbcli              # SAP HANA database client
# pip install sqlalchemy          # SQL toolkit and ORM for Python
# pip install sqlalchemy-hana     # SAP HANA dialect for SQLAlchemy

# 📚 Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd               # For data manipulation and Excel export
from hdbcli import dbapi          # SAP HANA DBAPI for direct connection
import warnings                   # To suppress unnecessary warnings
import os                         # For file path and directory handling

# 🚫 Suppress warnings for cleaner output
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# 🔐 Define SAP Datasphere connection parameters
# 👉 Replace the placeholders below with your actual connection details
db_user = '<your_database_user>'           # User with access to target schema
db_password = '<your_secure_password>'     # Password (handle securely)
db_host = '<your_datasphere_host_url>'     # Host URL (e.g., xyz.hanacloud.ondemand.com)
db_port = 443                               # Default HTTPS port for SAP HANA Cloud
db_schema = '<your_schema_name>'           # Target schema containing views

# 📁 Ensure output folder exists for Excel exports
output_folder = r'C:\Datasphere\Excel export'  # Update path as needed
os.makedirs(output_folder, exist_ok=True)

# 📋 Define list of views to extract data from
# 👉 Add or modify view names based on your schema
view_list = ['VIEW_1', 'VIEW_2']  # Example views

try:
    # 🌐 Establish secure connection to SAP Datasphere
    connection = dbapi.connect(
        address=db_host,
        port=db_port,
        user=db_user,
        password=db_password,
        encrypt=True,
        sslValidateCertificate=True
    )
    print("✅ Connected to SAP Datasphere")

    cursor = connection.cursor()

    # 🔁 Loop through each view and export its data
    for view_name in view_list:
        try:
            # 📊 Construct and execute SQL query
            sql_query = f'SELECT * FROM "{db_schema}"."{view_name}"'
            print(f"📊 Executing query: {sql_query}")
            cursor.execute(sql_query)

            # 📥 Fetch results and convert to DataFrame
            rows = cursor.fetchall()
            columns = [desc[0] for desc in cursor.description]
            df = pd.DataFrame(rows, columns=columns)

            # 📤 Export DataFrame to Excel
            output_path = os.path.join(output_folder, f'{view_name}.xlsx')
            df.to_excel(output_path, index=False)
            print(f"✅ Data from '{view_name}' saved to: {output_path}")

        except dbapi.Error as view_err:
            print(f"❌ Error querying '{view_name}': {view_err}")

except dbapi.Error as db_err:
    print(f"❌ Database error: {db_err}")
except Exception as ex:
    print(f"⚠️ Unexpected error: {ex}")
finally:
    # 🔒 Ensure connection is closed gracefully
    if 'connection' in locals():
        connection.close()
        print("🔒 Connection closed")

Script Capabilities

  • Establishes secure connection to SAP Datasphere
  • Executes queries on each listed view
  • Saves data from each view into a separate Excel file
  • Stores all files in a defined folder

Only connection details and view names need to be updated. The script handles the rest.

 One-Click Execution with a .bat File

To simplify execution, create a  RunExport.bat file to run the Python script with a double-click.

Double-clicking the file will automatically export all views to Excel without opening a terminal

 off
REM Activate Python and run the Export script

REM Change to the script directory
cd /d "C:\Datasphere\Excel export"

REM Run the Python script
python Export.py

REM Pause to keep the window open (optional)
pause

Example

Before Execution 

Double Click on "RunExcel.bat" file

Post Execution

Conclusion
This automation simplifies data exports from SAP Datasphere, especially when working with multiple views.

  • It reduces manual effort
  • improves consistency and saves time.
  • ideal for recurring tasks or scheduled jobs.

For setup support or customization, feel free to connect.

Thanks

Vikas Parmar

SAP Datasphere SAP Business Data Cloud Python

entry.title: How to edit a quota assignment in SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC)?
entry.content:
Symptom: You need to edit (increase or reduce) the quota assignment in SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) for SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere and SAP Databricks. 

Requirements: You need to have purchased SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) and have an S-user with the assigned role for Super Administrator or Cloud Administrator in SAP for Me. 

Resolution: 

1. Open SAP for Me and log in.

2. Navigate to the "Dashboards" section and click "Portfolio & Products".

3. Select "Business Data Cloud" in "My Product Suites".

4. Go to "Solutions", pick the tenant (SAC, SAP Datasphere or SAP Databricks) you want to edit the quota assignment, click in the "..." and then "Edit".

5. A new popup will appear. Click "Next". 

6. Update the quota assignment and then click "Next". In this example, we update for SAP Datasphere, but you can change for SAP Analytics Cloud based on number of users and SAP Databricks on capacity units. If you don't know how capacity units you want to assign, please access the SAP BDC Capacity Unit Estimator (more guidance here). 

7. Click "Review". 

8. Click "Finish". 

9. See "Updating solution" message and wait for the updates to be finished.
